topic.title: Good things to host
topic.body:
This is running on a big fat server I own and dedicated to privacy services. Zero, Freenet, Tor, I2P, all are running on this machine and I'm not even close to capacity.

What are some other things like that to host, things that could really use my capacity?

1585234073_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: Probably very few people are dying OF it. Media created hoax, everybody trying to get their dirty fingers on some of the loot and manipulate the public.

> [ranshit](#comment_139_17XPGJDqy3F7zfV3sa4aMJF2Mhpati6N12): Country [...]

21% of NYC has had it. 4.86% of them didn't die of it. This is silly, you can't call just the people who had a bad enough case to get medical treatment the "infected" and do math with that.

> [ranshit](#comment_140_17XPGJDqy3F7zfV3sa4aMJF2Mhpati6N12): The 2016 census says their are over 8.55 mil people of NY alone, meanwhile JHMU shows there are  291,996 confirmed cases in NY with 111,583 recovered and 22,668 dead. Now ( as of 4/28/2020, 8:31:21 AM)... ~444k people is no where near the 21% infected that you have claimed, more around ~5.19% has been confirmed to have or has it. [...]

https://www.foxnews.com/us/new-york-antibody-study-early-results

They tested random people. Now this probably excludes people who already know they have or have had it, so the actual infection rate will be even higher. Sorry but you've been sheared sheep!

If you know New York it's obvious what is going on. It's all about mass transit and not washing your hands. Hardly anyone will let you use the bathroom in NYC and in California they do so they don't have as much of a problem. Twice as many minorities have it because they all use buses and subways while whites usually ride Uber and you can't ride the subway at late night if you're white anyway. More men than women had it because girls always wash hands when they piss while most guys don't bother unless they pissed on their hands. It's all about washing your hands and not putting em in your mouth and that's how you get everything. Everything else is bullshit.

> [xcape2net](#comment_732_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Where I live in the United States, very few people are taking covid-19 seriously.  I had no choice but to go somewhere yesterday.  One woman I ran into was delivering balloons to her daughter.  Obviously, she thought delivering balloons while the state was locked down was worth risking her life?!!!  I saw at least 2 dozen people.  Other than me, no one under 75 was wearing a mask, except for one woman who was in a wheelchair with an oxygen bottle strapped to it.  I saw people driving everywhere and cars parked at stores and restaurants and everywhere else.  I guess covid-19 must be one of nature's means of culling the human population of idiots!

Where is the evidence that wearing a mask will do anything at all? Sounds like one of those "common knowledge" things to me.

> [xcape2net](#comment_749_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): We let the good topics die too soon on ZeroNet.  After months go by, those posts are harder to find. [...]

No, all phony. If it was as dangerous as the Spanish Flu we would have known by now. There is no way to hide that much illness.

It's just not that dangerous. Same kinds of people died of it as any regular flu. Hyped up by the media for sensationalism, exploited by the pro-China Left to shut down the US working class. The upper and upper middle class didn't have any problems at all.

1587415105_18xxerUUwEh2hVsNw1Ym6pML9Jfwi.body:
> [megatonjim](#comment_24_18xxerUUwEh2hVsNw1Ym6pML9JfwiKLUJT): The bitch in question: Camden Dorsett 532 Cedar Street, Carrollton, GA 30117

Yeah if it was so bad why did she publicize it?  She probably enjoyed it and was just mad she didn't think of it first. She should be dealt with.

1587248692_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [blahblah69](#comment_53_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4j8d6q): i use https://mewe.com/ on the surface net.

Mewe is a good choice for non-tech people, being as easy to use as Facebook. Haven't had any problem with censorship. I don't post racist stuff because I'm not racist, but plenty of mainstream porn and anti-fag and nothing has been taken down.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2070_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The irony. IDK why my gay friend was being censored making gay jokes.

Maybe the censor was also gay. Gay envy?

1587581309_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eH.body: That was a pretty cool trick. It reminds me of the old old time malware that would spin the hell out of your drive and ruin it, which wasn't that hard to do back then. The kiddies here don't remember dropping a machine and ruining your new 40 MB Winchester drive!

> [cexy](#comment_23_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): I only remember using 1.44 mb floppy disc and 32 mb RAM. It's incredible how sucha sheit Windows is used by big and medium companies isn't it? It's said it will pass into history as the only OS wrote entirely by CIA.

It had to be dumbed down. Most people at the time couldn't handle MSDOS, let alone the UNIX-like systems.

> [cexy](#comment_35_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): There are linux distros that are very easy to use for basics (stuff 97% people do) that have higher security than windows, right? So why sheitsoft made theirs so crappy?

Yeah now there are, but that's new. Lots of people bought the old Red Hat boxed distro and were never able to use it. The flaws in Windows now seem to be caused by making it a user non-interactive experience. Windows from the beginning was always intended to make a computer more like a television.

> [cexy](#comment_41_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): Another thing that bothers me. How many linux IT schools or courses can you find out there? Have you ever heard any government agency ever promote interest in linux systems? [...]

There's really nothing to struggle with anymore. I could give a muggle a Linux Mint system and it might take them 5 minutes to figure out the different icons for the way most muggles use their desktop, which is their browser and the office stuff. Then they wouldn't know the difference. It's more the gaming world driving Windows now, and the lowest level people don't want anything that isn't a phone. But it's not like any of that interferes with the FOSS world, we still can get everything we need.

1587670973_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3Sdu.body:
> [anshorei](#comment_87_1CgdRv2BFaVqNfmK3qGVYDuA7EDmk8dJVS): Probably libertarian, that's definitely where I'd fall. [...]

Now that clearnet tech and media have clearly picked a side,  most of the people gravitating to mainstream alt-tech (Gab, Minds, Mewe etc.) are clearly on the other side. But those services are more or less libertarian organizationally, I don't think there are any explicitly right wing platforms nor any with a right wing censorship policy. Alt-alt-tech like Zeronet or Freenet attracts more tech people for tech reasons rather than just people looking to get away from establishment-Left bias so the effect is less pronounced and you'll probably find more apolitical people here, with a libertarian slant due to the presence of illegality.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2083_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Good thing is that the MSM can't honestly paint us all as extremists if most of us are around the middle, but give them time and they will lie about us anyway.

I don't think there even is a middle anymore. Middle of what? The MSM is establishment, that's one side, and everybody else regardless of their particulars has to fight against them for representation. Only difference is the progressive types are more dependent on the establishment, and a guy who is working for MSM or deploying censorbots for Google or Facebook probably has to do a lot of shit he doesn't personally believe in but he doesn't have a choice because the establishment controls his industry. While my people can put on our MAGA hats and beat on the establishment without restraint, and the legitimate progs don't bother us and we don't bother them.

> [consus](#comment_30_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRRTYCd3): Zeronet is neeeeeither. It just so happens that the people who take issue with the government find themselves on the margins of society, along with other "undesirables", anti-social computer nerds, boys who get addicted to internet porn, and intellectual neurotic introverted neurotics.

It also filters for people who are smart enough to do something more than click on a phone app.

1587734994_1GLrPVFs91nhs2HYnxZj8BXL8pYSd.body: Popular conspiracy theories: Professional wrestling is fake. Politicians are corrupt. The Nigerian prince isn't really going to send me any money, and he's not even a prince. Police lie. Wealthy and influential people engage in some disturbing things to entertain themselves. Which of these do you think are nonsense?

> [boot13](#comment_8_1PxMvud9KvbqaSZnV4piygA6dFTASwapHY): Thanks for that. You're not alone here. The really annoying thing about all the conspiracy nonsense is that it typically overlaps with real problems, like corporate greed. Thankfully, there's a cure for conspiracy nuttery: formal education.

Or maybe the opposite. Formal education in itself doesn't do very much and it would be true to say that formality of any kind IS a conspiracy, although not always a harmful one. The way to determine whether a conspiracy theory reflects reality or not is logic. "If this is true, than that must also be true" and "If that is not true, than this must be true." Most of the theories I am familiar with contain some logically probable things mixed with the highly improbable, and they have to be sorted. Not that I expect everyone to do that because people believe or disbelieve based on their own ideas, and the same people who say there is no Deep State conspiracy will say that there is an oil company conspiracy, the celebrities and politicians aren't trafficking in children but the Catholic Church is,  Fox News is propaganda but CNN isn't, and so forth.

> [epistemic](#comment_4_1GLrPVFs91nhs2HYnxZj8BXL8pYSdKNu4L): Just a clarification: [...]

That's true, and there is no reason to make the jump to "PizzaGate" from "a well-connected pedophile who owns a pizzeria was abusing children there and allowing others to do the same" or "Covid was an engineered bioweapon" from "The Chinese were screwing around with something that endangered us all."

On the other hand it is equally erroneous to take it the other way, that because these things are associated with conspiracy theories that do not withstand logical analysis none of it must be true. I am sure that there are vaccines that are overused and insufficiently tested. Likewise that there are governments and people in our government  that would be OK with martial law and extermination, and I know that from history. Now only the worst crackpots are Holocaust deniers but when it was happening there were perfectly reasonable people who dismissed it as Soviet propaganda. Ten years ago Cosby, Spacey, Epstein and Weinstein were all considered fine upstanding citizens, despite that they had already done what we now know they did anyone who said so would be both dismissed as a conspiracy theorist and correct. So I'm willing to wade through all of it and see how much is real.

> [epistemic](#comment_5_1GLrPVFs91nhs2HYnxZj8BXL8pYSdKNu4L): "PizzaGate" has been thoroughly debunked.https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Pizzagate [...]

You seemed to have responded to a post I didn't make. What even is "Pizzagate?" That there is a nationwide conspiracy of child molestation in pizzerias, or that there is someone who owns a pizzeria who molests children? The former is an extraordinary claim, the latter is no more extraordinary than one of a day care worker or youth sports coach molesting children. 

Regarding totalitarian governments, I don't need to know any more than the nature of governments, historical and present, to know that is it something we all have to be wary of. They crave power, rule by force, and those presently in charge do their best to keep it that way in every other case, and there is no reason to believe there is anything exceptional about my government and politicians. I don't need to know any more about cops to be concerned that during a traffic stop I may be beaten, shot, or have evidence planted on me, and that my neighbor walking his dog is less likely to do that to me. We have totalitarian and homicidal governments in the world now, and we like to think we could never become like them but we also know that everyone had thought that, until they were.  Germans had previously been tolerant and ethical people, until they weren't, and it didn't take a conspiracy theorist to realize what was going to happen to you after you got on the train, just someone who wasn't sure that "The Germans are civilized, they would never do such a thing." 

Also note that I am not coming to any conclusions. But I'm willing to let those who have make their case. The difference between Pizzagate/Qanon type theories and Trump-Russian theories is no more than the perceived authority of those making them, and I do not trust Anderson Cooper and Rachel Maddow or some gay actor on Twitter any more than I do an anon in an anon forum. How are they different, just richer? Arguments from authority or wealth don't do it for me. You might be surprised how much you have accepted just from authority.

1587761800_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2ze.body:
> [pyra](#comment_23_1F87dd49JyvrShxjTz6jszGnxm7bn8if6m): Are these services for just you or to share with other people?

For public anon use, similar to running a tor node or I2P router, which are already running.  Nice if I could monetize it a little too but that's secondary.
Yeah Matrix is good. I already use Riot,  I think I'll do that.

1587791009_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMr.body:
Some good points are made but I think it diverges too much in directions that aren't useful.

The most obvious to me is that people who are doing what is being implied wouldn't have to go the the legal non-nude sites referenced. Probably everyone who uses anon services knows where hardcore CP can be found and if they are so vile pictures of little girls in bathing suits aren't going to do it for them. If what they are actually offering is not the pictures but the children themselves there would be no reason to put it on clearnet. I can't imagine they would be too stupid to put it on a hidden service especially now that they are readily accessible through Firefox, but who knows, I could be wrong.

1588273161_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRR.body: "Calmatters" is a political group that serves the purpose of getting state government positions out into media when it's something they don't want to put in an official government press release.

> [cexy](#comment_53_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): As to always be able to keep things separate and play psychological games? Controlled hearsay instead of simple direct statements than can't easily be taken back?

Yeah cexy you get it. It also eliminates the legal ramifications of using government offices for politicking.

1588376339_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4.body: Never give up your weapons. Nothing good ever happens after that.  Everyone using Zeronet should understand the theory behind decentralizing power.

1588505836_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body: It's nothing like communism. Communism is a governmental system backed by force, FOSS is something you write if you want and use if you want.

When you use "crypto" as a prefix for an ideology you're saying it's disguised as something else. Open source and decentralized software isn't disguised as anything. Sorry I am not into Wikipedia.

Open source projects do not have the characteristics of any kind of communism, nor of anarchy. For example anyone can modify the source, take it private and sell it. Then what are the anarchists going to do, call the police? There always is a hierarchy on the official git, and there wouldn't even be an official git if it was truly anarchistic. Some open source devs have financial backing for their projects and are paid, especially where cryptocurrency is involved. You can run your project differently if you want to, but to say open source as a rule is anarchistic or communistic just isn't true.

1588519592_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
Who the hell licks a toilet bowl anyway? Wouldn't you expect to get sick?

Just like all these people who eat ass now. Fucking anilingus. It spreads disease and you might as well lick a toilet bowl.

1588494290_1LsxokXjHhAjgc7eh1eYPEBXzvyv5.body:
It's not new and the American film industry has always been part of American propaganda, until they became part of Chinese propaganda. Lots of entertainers have too because they can travel around the world and meet with powerful people, and it doesn't look like anything more than those people just wanting to meet a celebrity. The way the military did it was lend the filmmakers equipment and footage on the condition they always portray them in a positive light. That's fair being you wouldn't want to help someone who trashes you either. 

Now the big media conglomerates figure they can make more money in China than the US because of the population, and if they don't support China they're going to pirate everything and they won't make anything. That's why most of what they make sucks for an American audience now.

1589664235_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRR.body: The only people they will ever catch using such a tactic are people who either have no intention of breaking a law or minimal capability to do so. But I think that may be the intent, they're not so much interested in real terrorists but in framing people up so they can pose like heroes.

> [consus](#comment_31_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRRTYCd3): So nice of them to do this while everyone is unemployed, and being denied their civil liberties cause "virus".  Well my friends, the only way the government will stop is when they do not have the resources to do so, and when left and right wing stop wanting more fucking "SAFETY". (I hate that damn word! It's an excuse for everything!) The only way that's going to happen is during struggle, strife, famine, WAR. I think instead of making laws, politicians should be finding ways to reduce laws. That was the purpose of the checks and balances...

The poison pill was the 19th Amendment. Women are wired to give up their freedom for safety. They complain about how difficult and dangerous their lives are, but only when they make it so. If you have a cunt, men will protect it. But no one will protect my balls but me. 

Thus men understand that safety provided by others is an illusion, while freedom makes you more able to provide your own. Adult men don't need the government to protect them any more than they need their mothers to protect them. Women will never understand that which is why their participation in democracy is problematic.

1590020097_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: And it turns out it wasn't her project, wasn't her code, and she was the one insisting that questionable data be used.

1590192659_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMr.body:
I spotted one: z0net

Not really, that's just an opinion with nothing to back it up. Everybody has one or more. But it defeats the purpose of an open source distributed network if we're all going to become little Zuckerbergs and try and silence people and things we don't like. The remedy for bad speech is more speech.

> [z0net](#comment_58_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMrYDJfS): While I do agree with this, there is a difference between users trying to sabotage the platform or free speech and people you don't like. Infact, I think it leads to more balanced discussion to have opposing viewpoints.The users that this thread is made for tracking are from the former group, and not the latter.It is very important to make that distinction. [...]

If you  don't want to read a shitposter, block him. No one objects to Facebook having a block feature. It's when someone else makes the decision for you, that something is a shitpost and that person is a shitposter and you need to be protected from him whether you like it or not that it offends the sensibilities of the freedom-loving.

But how different is organizing a blocklist from that? Does anyone here need you to tell them who to block? It's social manipulation, publicly disparaging a person who does not meet your standards. Not very useful practically, we can all make new ID's too, all it does is detract form a person who already has an established presence, and if someone already has a presence we can all see what he has to say and be the judge for ourselves if it's shitposting.

> [zaron](#comment_97_193HCur1fDFo7RoPUnQ1poMMexP4M9tbcU): Freenet ran into the same problem. if you want free speech you have to deal with all the shit. including illegal shit

That's true, Freenet has some outrageously bad stuff. No worse than onionland though. But some of it is illegal for me and other things are legal for me, but will get you executed in some countries and I'm glad it's there for the people who have to live in those conditions..

> [ransbits](#comment_33_1H9xEgESUhfvpYK3SLLqabc1uLT2jsmH2A): I see Blocklists being comparable to a Newspaper. Some people subscribe to one or more newspapers while other people subscribe to none. Sure, they hear about how 'great' the Newspapers are from their friends and others, but some people would just rather do without for one reason or another. [...]

If you think you need someone to monitor "hate speech" and protect you from undesirable characters, stick to Facebook. Alt-social is supposed to be the opposite of that, is it not? Maybe it's because I'm an old timer from the days of Usenet and IRC and dialup that it seems odd to me, but there have always been people online who say things I wouldn't say and like porn that I don't like and it's nothing to be afraid of. Block lists used to be called killfiles and I never used one. Just like the chans this is not for everyone and if you try to make it for everyone it's going to be geared to accommodate the weakest people in society like the corporate socials are now.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2245_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): MOAB isn't about legal porn nor hate speech. It's about spam, CP and terrorism. There's only one blocklist for porn in general and that's by SSD. None are for hate speech.

Why do you need to publish a list that blocks that, and why would you think it would be effective? Professional spammers generate hundreds of ID's per day. Actual practicing terrorists do not make their plans public, and the ones who are not practicing are just philosophers, no need to block them. I am sure the CP's have their own places here just like they have their own onions, I'm not going to go to them, and if someone wants to talk about pedophilia any place else I'm going to either ask him questions to satisfy my curiosity about why someone would want to do that, or just scroll on by like I do thousands of other things. None of this is necessary for users who exercise a little self-discipline.

1590447717_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body: That we're going to go retro! Popular Western culture, music, entertainment, commerce is going to take on the characteristics of the late 70's- early 90's. Because we liked it better that way, and the direction (not quantity) of advancement promoted by globalism was not something we ever consented to.

1590565377_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
> [xcape2net](#comment_739_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): You may want to be getting a list of bridges while you still can, so you will have them when China starts blocking Tor nodes.

Maybe Zeronet would be a good place to list bridge nodes?

1590689346_13gz7jEayVZjubcAGS16kR3Ze4RJS.body: Not the problem. At issue is their subsection 230 exemption from libel suits, which requires them to NOT dissent and not be anything other than a conduit for other people's content. People get sued for stuff they post on social media all the time and once the company has a hand in regulating or censoring it, they're involved.

1590041703_19y1ZG2DVeRM65kYxKcLz7MLGTfTf.body: They're probably cop sites, and they're probably not in Russia but in the US, where the government can get away with anything if they can convince the public it's "for the children." The US government has the largest collection of CP in the world and they distribute tons of it in hopes of catching some old guys jerking off, guys who do NOT have any children available. The people who produce the material and traffic in children themselves DO have children available, and the authorities have little interest in pursuing them. Too much work.

1590898064_1H9xEgESUhfvpYK3SLLqabc1uLT2j.body: Quit attracting the attention of cops, you won't have as much contact with them and these things will be less likely to happen.

Floyd was an asshole. Enough fent in him to kill anybody, fighting with the cops. The cops should have been more professional, it doesn't excuse them, but when you go around living like George Floyd it's only a matter of time and luck when something kills you. Could be the dope, could be another bad guy he crosses, or it could be a cop. It works the same way for anybody of any color, I'm white and guarantee I could get a cop to kill me if I tried.

> [ransbits](#comment_64_1H9xEgESUhfvpYK3SLLqabc1uLT2jsmH2A): Hey, me too!  I'm white and I guarantee that the officer wouldn't even get me into the handcuffs.I got my Wuhan-mask, sun glassess, and hat with me because I really don't need a reason to shit on facial recognition. So a pointed finger under my shirt would be sure to grant me a swift exit from this existence. [...]

He didn't try? Going around all fucked up,  committing a crime, then fighting with the cops when they get you is a solid plan. I've been arrested plenty of times and if you run, fight, or answer any questions you're just a fool who isn't going to be around long no matter what color you are.

1590981433_19mfoWfh42vCabe3TVkFSXRTJKyFq.body: Yes, I agree. This has been bothering me for a long time. Gee, if only there was some action I could take or some group I could join that would help me, but I don't know about anything like that.

1591131478_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:

Likely just China, in retaliation for the tariffs. I say we give them more tariffs.

1591301277_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: LoRa/LoRaWAN is a mature technology and might be a good thing to investigate for this. Because of the long range a meshnet can get started faster with fewer operators.

1591403223_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
Why do people think there is a clear distinction between Antifa and Neonazis? All socialists looking for control, they will do a lot better working together than against each other. 

Antifa will provoke and exploit blacks, but they don't take blacks into their inner circle because they know they have more loyalty to their race than any political cause. So if they're planning to do some bad shit involving black people and they have black members they won't accept that and they'll turn them in. Same for religious people, if you're not solid atheist they won't trust you for the same reason.

Trump, Soros etc. are not directly involved. It's all about economics in the US and how these people make their money. During Obama a lot of tax dollars were transferred to non-profit organizations and the leaders are all people who work for them or something related to them making good money with bullshit degrees.  You have no idea how easy it is to make $150K-250K with a gender studies degree if you are in with the right people who can get a contract with a city. Trump has been shutting all that down financially, supporting factories and farmers instead and they are afraid of personal poverty.  So if they can get rid of Trump and trash the cities at the same time they can get even more money from the next guy.

1591733013_18LjTpx4UtPSFfAZi8kfoyWasJq9g.body: A real guinea or frog can make a good receipe out of anything.

1591795514_13i223c4P7HfiKEu9cxEGXptQ77i8.body: Go in there, give them 1 hour to vacate, and then gun them all down.

> [zaron](#comment_129_193HCur1fDFo7RoPUnQ1poMMexP4M9tbcU): Sounds like something a true dictatorship would do

A true dictatorship is is exactly what they are doing. Did they ask the people who live and work there if they wanted to have an additional, unelected government imposed on them? Did they have a vote?

Here is the usual order of operations for such projects:
1) Everybody shows up, thinking it's going to be a good time, and brings things with them.
2) Too many people, no clear delineations of who belongs where and who owns what. They think they are going to live together and share everything like one big happy family but a lot of families suck, and when you're the only one with anything to share it gets old.
3) Regardless of what they say about a common cause, they all went there for their own reasons and some of those reasons are not compatible. People form tribes and cliques for protection/exploitation, and the leaders of those tribes (there always are, that's what primates do) start making demands of their members.
4) They run out of money and weed. More weed is available locally, but the only thing they have to pay for it with is cunt, and only some of them have cunts. How would you like to be a girl there and some guy wants to pay for his weed with your cunt? There's rape, and the girls start to leave. They will try to prevent them from leaving. A lot of those guys are fags and males will get abused too.
5) After a period of time you have only bitter-enders left and it takes on the character of the Jonestown cult. Lots of violence and destruction. Cops have had enough and they move in, standoff, hostage situation, people shot. The area is declared a disaster and it's declared all Trump's fault.
6) Wait 20 years, forget the lesson, repeat.

Bullshit. That's Muslim propaganda. Spain, Portugal, France, Great Britain, Netherlands were the naval powers of the Atlantic, they all had colonies in Africa and in the New World, and they were the only ones with the power to traffic slaves across the ocean. Jews had very few rights in those countries.

Not to say that there weren't any Jews in that business because there are Jews in every business. In the US there were probably more Jews on the Confederate side than the Union side. But some of us don't think that's such a bad thing.
